definition: to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: And Im sure Parker works her socks off .
sentences.chinese: 我确信帕克工作非常卖命。

sentences.english: Be he sick or well, he works entirely hard.
sentences.chinese: 无论是生病还是身体健康，他都会卖命地工作。

sentences.english: She works so hard that she is often neglectful of her family.
sentences.chinese: 她工作非常卖命，常常连家都忘了。

sentences.english: Each relevant department is respoible for specific implementation.
sentences.chinese: 各相关部份卖命详细施行。

sentences.english: The workers worked themselves to the bone for the capitalists.

definition: one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to vow loyalty and devotion to
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
from the cradle to the grave (idiom); to go through fire and water/brave/willing to risk life and limb
to rely on help from sb
